page.title: 14A Home in Kettlesing
page.content: The majority of houses are former farmhouses or agricultural cottages, now modernised to a very high stan- dard and generally in keeping with local tradition. There is a scattering of new housing - a string of bungalows at Tang, and scattered individual houses, mainly retirement homes. The oldest house is probably West Syke Green Farm in Felliscliffe, which is reputed to have timber joints dating back to the fourteenth century. Tang Farm has remained largely unaltered, being a fine example of a Dales farmhouse, and still having a thatched barn. Near the Anglican church lies a row of very attractive Victorian almshouses, built by local benevolence.
